Package ohos.media.audio

Class AudioRenderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.media.audio.AudioRenderer

  • public class AudioRenderer
extends Object
    Provides interfaces for applications to play, pause, and stop pulse-code modulation (PCM) audio.

    This class manages and plays an audio resource for an application. Audio buffers are transferred to the audio receiver for playback.

    Since:
    1
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Multimedia#AUDIO

    • Nested Class Summary

      Modifier and Type Class Description

      Specifies the volume of audio channels.

      Describes playback modes.
      static class  AudioRenderer.SpeedPara
      Provides parameters related to the playback speed and pitch.
      static class  AudioRenderer.State
      Describes player status.

      • AudioRenderer

        public AudioRenderer​(AudioRendererInfo audioRendererInfo,
                     AudioRenderer.PlayMode pm)
              throws IllegalArgumentException
        Creates an AudioRenderer instance based on a specified AudioRendererInfo instance and playback mode. The playback device is the default one.
        Parameters:
        audioRendererInfo - Indicates information about the audio streams to play.
        pm - Indicates the stream playback mode.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if a parameter is invalid.
        Since:
        2

        public AudioRenderer​(AudioRendererInfo audioRendererInfo,
                     AudioRenderer.PlayMode pm,
                     AudioDeviceDescriptor outputDevice)
              throws IllegalArgumentException
        Creates an AudioRenderer instance based on a specified AudioRendererInfo instance, playback mode, and playback device.
        Parameters:
        audioRendererInfo - Indicates information about the audio streams to play.
        pm - Indicates the stream playback mode.
        outputDevice - Indicates information about the preference output device of this AudioRenderer.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if a parameter is invalid.
        Since:
        2

        Obtains audio playback status.
        Returns:
        Returns audio playback status, which is defined by State.

      • start

        public boolean start​()
        Plays audio streams.

        To play audio streams in MODE_STATIC mode, you need to call the write method before this method.

        Returns:
        Returns true if the audio streams are played; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • pause

        public boolean pause​()
        Pauses audio stream playback.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the playback is paused; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • stop

        public boolean stop​()
        Stops playing audio streams.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the playback is stopped; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • release

        public boolean release​()
        Releases playback resources.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the resources are released; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • getMinBufferSize

        public static int getMinBufferSize​(int sampleRate,
                                   AudioStreamInfo.EncodingFormat format,
                                   AudioStreamInfo.ChannelMask channelMask)
        Obtains the minimum buffer size required to ensure normal audio stream playback in PlayMode#MODE_STREAM mode.
        Parameters:
        sampleRate - Indicates the sampling rate of the audio stream.
        format - Indicates the encoding format of the audio stream.
        channelMask - Indicates the audio channel mask.
        Returns:
        Returns the buffer size (in bytes) if obtained; returns a value less than or equal to 0 otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • write

        public boolean write​(short[] data,
                     int offset,
                     int size)
        Writes audio data to an audio receiver for playback in MODE_STREAM mode, or copies the audio data for later playback in MODE_STATIC mode.

        This is a synchronous method that returns the result until all the data is written. You can set a short integer array to write audio data for both MODE_STREAM and MODE_STATIC playback.

        Parameters:
        data - Indicates data to be written.
        offset - Indicates the offset (in shorts), which defines the beginning placement to write the data.
        size - Indicates the shorts of data to be written.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the data is written; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • write

        public boolean write​(byte[] data,
                     int offset,
                     int size)
        Writes audio data to an audio receiver for playback in MODE_STREAM mode, or copies the audio data for later playback in MODE_STATIC mode.

        You can set a byte array to write audio data for both MODE_STREAM and MODE_STATIC playback.

        Parameters:
        data - Indicates data to be written.
        offset - Indicates the offset (in bytes), which defines the beginning placement to write the data.
        size - Indicates the bytes of data to be written.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the data is written; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • write

        public boolean write​(float[] data,
                     int offset,
                     int size)
        Writes the specified type of audio data into an audio receiver for playback in MODE_STREAM mode, or copies the audio data for later playback in MODE_STATIC mode.

        This is a synchronous method that returns the result until all the data is written. You can set a float array to write audio data for both MODE_STREAM and MODE_STATIC playback.

        Parameters:
        data - Indicates the data to be written.
        offset - Indicates the offset into which the data will be written.
        size - Indicates the size of the float data to be written.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the data is written; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • write

        public boolean write​(ByteBuffer data,
                     int size)
        Writes ByteBuffer audio data into an audio receiver for playback in MODE_STREAM mode, or copies the audio data for later playback in MODE_STATIC mode.

        You can set a ByteBuffer instance to write audio data for both MODE_STREAM and MODE_STATIC playback.

        Parameters:
        data - Indicates the data to be written.
        size - Indicates the size of the ByteBuffer data to be written.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the data is written; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • setVolume

        public boolean setVolume​(float vol)
        Sets output volume for all audio channels.

        You can use vol to set the same volume for both left and right channels.

        Parameters:
        vol - Indicates the output volume.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the volume is set; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • setVolume

        public boolean setVolume​(AudioRenderer.ChannelVolume channelVolume)
        Sets output volume for an audio channel.

        This method sets left and right channel volume based on the value defined in ChannelVolume.

        Parameters:
        channelVolume - Indicates the channel volume defined in ChannelVolume.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the volume is set; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • setPosition

        public boolean setPosition​(int position)
        Sets the position to start audio stream playback, which is represented by frames. This method is valid only for the playback in PlayMode#MODE_STATIC mode when the playback is stopped or paused.
        Parameters:
        position - Indicates the position to start audio stream playback, which is represented by frames.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the setting is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • setSpeed

        public boolean setSpeed​(float speed)
        Sets the playback speed.
        Parameters:
        speed - Indicates the playback speed, which must be greater than 0.0f.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the setting is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

        Returns true if the setting is successful; returns false otherwise.

      • getCurrentDevice

        public AudioDeviceDescriptor getCurrentDevice​()
        Obtains information about an audio playback device.

        The audio playback device is set using the AudioRenderer#AudioRenderer(AudioRendererInfo, PlayMode, AudioDeviceDescriptor) method.

        Returns:
        Returns the device information if any device is playing audio; returns null otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • getRendererSessionId

        public int getRendererSessionId​()
        Obtains the audio rendering session ID.
        Returns:
        Returns the ID of the audio rendering session where this AudioRenderer belongs to.
        Since:
        1

      • getSampleRate

        public int getSampleRate​()
        Obtains the sampling rate.
        Returns:
        Returns the sampling rate.
        Since:
        2

      • getPosition

        public int getPosition​()
        Obtains the playback position, which is represented by the number of audio frames played.

        The number of frames is a non-negative int value that continuously increases. It will be wrapped periodically, for example, once every 27 hours around for playback of 44.1 kHz audio streams. After the number of frames exceeds the value range of an int, the value will be reset to 0.

        Returns:
        Returns the position represented by the number of played frames.
        Since:
        2

      • getAudioTime

        public Timestamp getAudioTime​()
        Obtains the playback timestamp.

        You need to ensure that the timestamp is obtained during the audio stream playback. You can call getState() to check the playback state. In non-playback state, you should obtain the new timestamp periodically until you get the playback timestamp.

        Frequent calling of this method will cause low efficiency. The recommended frequency is no more than once every 15 seconds.

        Returns:
        Returns the audio playback Timestamp if obtained; returns a Timestamp with its member variables set to 0 otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • flush

        public boolean flush​()
        Refreshes the stream data queue of the current playback.

        Any data that has been written but not yet consumed will be discarded. This method is valid only for the playback in PlayMode#MODE_STREAM mode and when the playback is stopped or paused.

        Returns:
        Returns true if the operation is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • getPlaybackSpeed

        public AudioRenderer.SpeedPara getPlaybackSpeed​()
        Obtains the playback speed and pitch parameters.
        Returns:
        Returns the SpeedPara instance containing the speed and pitch parameters.
        Since:
        3

      • getBufferUnderflowTimes

        public int getBufferUnderflowTimes​()
        Obtains the number of times that the data in the audio buffer is insufficient. Playback stalls may occur when the audio buffer data is insufficient.
        Returns:
        Returns the number of times that the buffer data is insufficient.
        Since:
        4

      • setSendEffectLevel

        public void setSendEffectLevel​(float level)
        Sets the level of the send effect for audio playback.
        Parameters:
        level - Indicates the effect level to set. The value ranges from 0.0 to 1.0.
        Since:
        4

      • setFramePositionObserver

        public void setFramePositionObserver​(FramePositionObserver observer,
                                     int position,
                                     EventHandler handler)
        Sets an observer to listen for the event that the playback progress reaches a specified position.
        Parameters:
        observer - Indicates the observer to set.
        position - Indicates the playback position.
        handler - Indicates the event handler to invoke the observer. If you do not specify a handler, the default one will be used.
        Since:
        4

      • setFrameIntervalObserver

        public void setFrameIntervalObserver​(FrameIntervalObserver observer,
                                     int interval,
                                     EventHandler handler)
        Sets an observer to listen for the event that the playback progress reaches a multiple of interval.
        Parameters:
        observer - Indicates the observer to set.
        interval - Indicates the audio frame interval.
        handler - Indicates the event handler to invoke the observer. If you do not specify a handler, the default one will be used.
        Since:
        4

      • duckVolume

        public boolean duckVolume​()
        Decreases the volume and mixes the audio with another application that has the audio focus. You can use unduckVolume() to restore the volume.

        This method is called when your application is notified by audio focus callback AudioInterrupt.InterruptListener.onInterrupt(int, int), with input parameters type and hint set to AudioInterrupt.INTERRUPT_TYPE_BEGIN and AudioInterrupt.INTERRUPT_HINT_NONE, respectively.

        Returns:
        Returns true if the volume is decreased; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • unduckVolume

        public boolean unduckVolume​()
        Restores the volume. You can call this method after duckVolume().

        This method is called when your application is notified by audio focus callback AudioInterrupt.InterruptListener.onInterrupt(int, int), with input parameters type and hint set to AudioInterrupt.INTERRUPT_TYPE_END and AudioInterrupt.INTERRUPT_HINT_RESUME, respectively.

        Returns:
        Returns true if the volume is restored; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3
